recommendations: Keshav Nag “I have had the pleasure of working closely with Sneha for the past couple of years at Fractal. Sneha is an exceptional data scientist who possesses a rare blend of technical expertise, analytical prowess, and a passion for delivering impactful insights. Throughout our collaboration, she consistently demonstrated an impressive ability to extract meaningful patterns from complex datasets, providing invaluable insights that informed our project decisions. One of Sneha's standout qualities is her proficiency in learning, selecting and applying the right statistical techniques and machine learning algorithms to solve intricate business challenges. Her willingness to keep an open mind and explore alternate solutions helped in solving complex problems in an agile manner. In addition to her technical contributions, Sneha is an excellent team player who actively contributes to brainstorming sessions and engages in constructive discussions. Her collaborative approach and willingness to share knowledge greatly enriched the team's overall performance and created a positive working environment. I highly recommend Sneha to any organization seeking a data scientist/analytics professional who can truly make an impact.”

Abhijeet Boridkar “I am delighted to recommend Sneha for tech roles, particularly data science. I've had the privilege of collaborating with Sneha and can confidently vouch for her exceptional skills and teamwork. Sneha possesses a robust skillset, showcasing expertise in Python, SQL, and Azure. She consistently demonstrates a profound understanding of these technologies and effectively applies them to solve intricate challenges. What sets Sneha apart is her teamwork proficiency. She excels in collaborative environments, fostering shared knowledge and positive group dynamics. Her excellent communication skills ensure seamless information exchange among team members.”
projects: [{"title":"Real time tag recommendation system on Stack Overflow data","start_date":"Oct 2023","end_date":"Nov 2023","description":"Developed this as a part of course project where we predicted the tags for Questions and answers dataset of Stack Overflow data which is of 5GB size. Set up the entire Azure environment to host the recommendation system. Created a separate SQL database to store the dataset and for training purposes in Azure environment. Designed the recommendation system in Pyspark using SparkNLP library and created an API out of it to host it in the Azure environment. Made use of the Stackoverflow API to read the data real time and predict the tag for real time queries. Achieved an overall accuracy of 88%. On the entire recommendation system, we also tried to study system based parameters such as runtime changing the threads and more. Recognised as one of the best projects in a class of 100+ people."},{"title":"Text augmentation using LLMs","start_date":"Oct 2023","end_date":"Nov 2023","description":"This project was taken up as a part of a course project 682 where we got to understand about Large Language models and key concepts of Natural Language Processing. It is quite common that classification and sentiment based models perform poorly when there is a huge imbalance in the dataset. There exist traditional methods of augmenting using library functions but they may not always necessarily lead the model to learn new features. It was also clear when we compared the augmented texts using traditional library methods, ChatGPT and other LLMs. It was observed that library methods do not produce much diverse augmented text and ChatGPT has done the best of all. Augmentation metrics such as cosine similarity were used to compare the augmentation results. It was observed that the models that used ChatGPT for classification and sentiment analysis tasks performed by at least 10 percent in accuracy."},{"title":"Load Runner","start_date":"Apr 2023","end_date":"Jun 2023","description":"Built the optimum shipment using Operations Research optimization algorithms which reduced the trucks used by 20%. Given the list of orders, we built the optimum shipment owing to maximum weight and maximum volume constraints of a given truck. Determined the stacking order owing to stacking weight, stacking index and space dynamics. Visualized the stacking and the list of items in each truck in PowerBI. Achieved overall 10 percent increase in Volume Fill Rate in the trucks compared to default STO order in the warehouse. Nominated for Kaizen star award and attracted more clients using this project."},{"title":"Command Center","start_date":"May 2022","end_date":"Feb 2023","description":"Took roles of SQL developer and SME in a cross-functional team of 35+ members to develop and deliver key features. Amended SQL queries to extract data from 6 databases using SSMS and helped in development of features in DevOps. Solely led the automation module which comprised of frontend, backend and testing team. Acted as SME for this automation module which automates the process of giving config inputs for different sites."},{"title":"Regeneron Hackathon","start_date":"Nov 2021","end_date":"Jan 2022","description":"Developed an analytics framework that helps to predict the next best patient type for first line usage in wAMD. Given data on patient purchase and medical history of more than 1 million data points, performed patient profiling alongside the analytics framework to predict the next best patient type. Preprocessed the data, synthesized new features and used this to train the model. Pyspark was used to train the model and achieved an accuracy of 87% when used LightGBM model. Implemented shaply analysis on the model to understand the key features affecting the model behavior."},{"title":"Crop Classification on Sentinel-2 data","start_date":"Jan 2021","end_date":"Apr 2021","description":"The increasing spatial demand and temporal resolution of satellite data has opened doors to the possibility of creating fine algorithms to predict patterns. In this project, Random Forest and TWDTW methods were implemented at both pixel and field level to observe crop patterns. Started off with understanding the images using different band data to get details such as presence of water, cloud density, vegetation cover and its health. Derived Normalised Difference Vegetative Index at pixel level which is used in further downstream tasks. Segmented the data using Multi Spectral Resolution algorithm and compared the model performances at both pixel and object level data. Observed that model has better accuracy when done at object level than at pixel level by at least 10 percent. TWDTW algorithm performed better than any machine learning algorithm by at least 5 percent."}]

honors_and_awards.title: Lear Spotlight Award
honors_and_awards.description: Honored with Lear Spotlight Award which was awarded to summer interns who had been performing great during the summer of 2020. As a part of the internship, I was mainly responsible for designing the batter cooling subsystem for an electric vehicle.
